solution_line_template: Each hectare of Johnson's neighbor can yield {johnson_yield_per_hectare} x {neighbor_yield_multiplier} = <<{johnson_yield_per_hectare}*{neighbor_yield_multiplier}={neighbor_yield_per_hectare}>>{neighbor_yield_per_hectare} corns every two months.

So, the neighbor's two-hectare cornfield can yield a total of {neighbor_yield_per_hectare} x {neighbor_hectares} = <<{neighbor_yield_per_hectare}*{neighbor_hectares}={neighbor_total_yield}>>{neighbor_total_yield} corns every two months.
They yield a total of {johnson_yield_per_hectare} + {neighbor_total_yield} = <<{johnson_yield_per_hectare}+{neighbor_total_yield}={total_yield_per_2_months}>>{total_yield_per_2_months} corns.
Therefore, They can harvest {total_yield_per_2_months} x {num_2_month_periods} = <<{total_yield_per_2_months}*{num_2_month_periods}={total_yield_6_months}>>{total_yield_6_months} corns altogether.
